citations.narrative:
The barrier for the 2 white nosed coatimundi was not completed on the right side. The barrier for the snow leopard cubs
was 2 ropes spaced far apart. Missing barriers and barriers consisting of 2 ropes may allow the public to contact the
animals. The public barrier must be constructed to ensure safety of the animal and the public. During public exhibition,
any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public, with sufficient distance and/or
barriers between the animal and the general viewing public so as to assure the safety of animals and the public.
CORRECT BY: 7/19/2023

A contingency plan was present, however the facility has added employees and they have not been trained on the plan.
Documentation of training of contingency plan for employees was not present. The employees must be trained to ensure
that they are aware of the contingency plan and are able to perform if necessary. Training of personnel must be
documented and completed within 30 days employment and document annual review of the plan.
CORRECT BY: 8/13/2023

The ends of the ropes of the swinging rope inf the capuchin monkey enclosure are badly frayed. The animal could wrap
the frayed rope around an appendage or ingest it, resulting in injury. The surfaces of housing facilities – including
perches, shelves, swings, boxes, houses, dens, and other furniture-type fixtures or objects within the facility – must be
constructed in a manner and made of materials that allow them to be readily cleaned and sanitized, or removed or
replaced when worn or soiled.
CORRECT BY: 7/19/2023
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
ELIZABETH PANNILL, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
